bwwExcerpt: Mark Wendland's two-tiered set constantly brims with people moving and singing. But there's no sense of kinetic energy, just strenuous bustle. Meanwhile the actors tackle the characters and Larson's now-iconic score with varying success. Rodriguez stands out as a badass Angel, while Reid and Christopher are in fine, warm voices. The biggest surprise is Ashford's bubbly and decidedly comic Maureen - the opposite of Idina Menzel's predatory one. It feels counterintuitive at times, but at least Ash
